review:
The product seems to be counterfeit of Philips LED bulb. The product I
received is of very poor built quality and I can even hear crackling sound for
one of the bulb when I shake it. I'm really shocked how 'Cloudtail India
Private Limited' is selling products like these without having proper quality
checks, this is very bad #Amazon, really disappointed.

I suspect the genuinity of the product. Poor Philips packing for each bulb.
Each bulb had some issue like unwanted glue, low quality leads and other
printing. The barcodes below the pack were pasted with white stickers to
disable scanning. When tampered to scan, it takes me to a dummy Philips site.  
Amazon, please check the genuinity of sellers / products which directly
affects the trust on Amazon.

Hai guys,  
  
I am writing this review after 7 months of usage and i want to share some
points from my experience.!🤔  
  
This is the first time i am purchasing a philips LED bulb and i can say that
it doesnt meet all my expectations.The product arrived in a good packaging
condition within 3 days of ordering..!(Amazon is best in that)😇  
  
Now time to discuss about the product;👇  
  
I purchased this product as a replacement for my 23w CFL bulb.😒  
  
I am not sure that whether 9w is enough as a replacement for 23w anyway i
thought of giving it as a try and the brightness of the LED is more than
expected(To be frank 9w led bulb have more brightness than the 23w CFL bulb)👍  
  
When i got the package one of the bulb have a small sound when i shake
it.Since its working i didnt cared about that but after six months of usage it
suddenly stopped working.👎  
  
Since i have the invoice with me i got a replacement from a nearby electrical
shop(Dont forget to keep the invoice,if there is any damage during the
warrranty peroid we will get the replacement so dont worry about that).👌  
  
Since LED bulbs have a life time of more than 10 years i am a bit disappointed
when one of the product gets damaged.(Anyway its ok,i got a new replacement)✌  
  
Finally one more thing .It is comparatively so small when compared to the CFL
bulb .(I will attach a pic of both the products in a single frame so you guys
can check it out) .😘  
  
Thats all about the prosuct i want to share .!☝  
  
👉Thanks 4 reading..!👈

** Performance & Usage **  
● The bulbs came in a well protected packing carton  
● The size of the bulb is smaller than standard Incandescent lamps and
slightly bigger than CFLs; however this fits in almost all fixtures made for
CFL  
● The colour matches that of standard fluroscent tubelights  
● There is no fluctuation of light that I could observe or notice  
● The bulb is not dimmable  
● The bulbs does not light up instantly, there is delay of a second or two
after you switch it on  
● It sufficiently lights up my kitchen where I installed it. I installed
another one outdoors where it is ON for the whole night  
● This has got a Lumens Output of 91.7 which means it consumes less
electricity. However, there are other bulbs available with Lumens Output close
to 100  
● There is a warning label that this should not be used in completley closed
light fixtures. It is bacause of the electronics involved that will need
ventilation to sink away the heat. Eventhough there is another label that says
this is for indoor use only, I have been using this for the last two weeks
outdoors without any issues  
● The bulb has got 1 year warranty from the date of purchase. To claim
warranty, you would need the invoice from Amazon  
● I paid Rs.519 in Feb-17 which is Rs.130 per bulb and I rate FIVE stars. I
will update this review after a few month's usage on the durability and
performance  
  
** LED Bulb Buying Guide **  
● Eventhough there are many parameters that you can look for like Lumens
Output, Power Factor, Colour Rendering Index, Colour Temperature, LED Life,
etc. while choosing the right LED bulb, if you look at the below three
parameters it will do good in making a better choice  
● Lumens  
\- The more the lumens, more the brightness. To get a rough idea on
brightness, I have listed the equivalent CFL and Incandescent bulbs that can
produce a listed Lumen  
\- 450 lm: 8-12 watt CFL; 40 watt Incandescent  
\- 800 lm: 13-18 watt CFL; 60 watt Incandescent  
\- 1200 lm: 18-22 watt CFL; 80 watt Incandescent  
\- 1700 lm: 23-30 watt CFL; 100 watt Incandescent  
This will help you decide on the Lumen that you need for your bulb  
● Colour Temperature  
\- Cool Light: Higher Colour Temperatures (above 3600K) are considered cool.
Cool light is good for office spaces, shopping centers, ertc. since it can
generate higher contrast. Eventhough most of the cool bulbs now available are
more than 5500K, the most comfrtable for our eyes is between 3600-5000K  
\- Warm Light: Lower Kelvin temperatures (2600 - 3100K) are considered warm.
These are slightly yellowish and warm light suits homes since it is more
flattering to skin tones and clothing  
● Lumens Output  
\- This indicates how efficient a bulb is. This can be calculated by dividing
the rated Lumens by the Wattage. For eg. this Wipro bulb has 825 lumens and 9
watt; so Lumens Output is 825/9 = 91.7  
\- Bulbs with Lumens Output less than 75 is average, 75-90 is good and 90-100
is the best  
\- There are many bulbs currently available with Lumens Output of 100  
  
** Summary **  
● If you need more brightness, pick a bulb with more Lumens  
● Select Warm Light for living rooms, bedrooms, etc. and Cool Light for
kitchen, outdoors, etc.  
● A bulb with more Lumen Output will consume less electricity than other bulbs  
● So, after shortlisting different brands of bulbs with your required Lumens
and colour temperature, buy the bulb with more Lumen Output and comparatively
less price  
● Lumens, Colour Temperature and Wattage will be printed on the packing carton
of LED bulbs.

I have received the product today - pack of 4. Observations are below:-  
  
.. Bulb boxes were damaged  
  
The product specification indicates 3223 Lumens ("Bulb Base: B22, Color
Temperature: 6500K, Lumens: 3224lm") while the details on the bulb case shows
825 lumens . Refer picture uploaded here. Not sure if I had received the right
product

Poor quality.  
I expected better from PHILIPS.  
I ordered 8 bulbs (2x4) and I receive 4 poor quality bulbs and 4 comparatively
better quality bulbs.  
Amazon never provided on door delivery.  
I always had to go with my bike ( Extra Expense).  
Very sadly one of the bulbs just gave a blink and never worked again.  
Since 7 other bulbs are working properly, I decided not to return the whole
package.  
It’s disgusting to go through all return processes. That’s not what we expect
from online shopping ( a disgusting week).  
Luminous intensity is same as other brands with same power ratings in the
market.  
Made of plastic except the heat sink.  
I opened and examined the faulty bulb and saw a bad capacitor and from my
personal opinion heat sinking arrangements could be better.  
Warranty offered is useless.  
Amazon is selling for 50% off . What’s the point in it. It is the market value
and from this experience I realise that I could have brought better product
from local market.

This is neither a review nor a statement. When i have decided to change my
home lighting and aesthetics, I have gone through many websites looking for a
better and healthy lighting system. After hours of research into LEDs, CFLs,
incandescent and fluorescent lights, the conclusion is what I felt like
sharing with.  
I try to be as objective and as simple I can be rather sounding technical.  
It seems that  
the LEDs may cause blindness over a long period of time.  
CFLs may generate UV radiation also are hazardous considering the internal
inert gases and the mercurial vapour.  
Incandescent bulbs are relatively better but they consume more power
unfortunately. Also few reports say that they raise cataract issues over a
time, but the high raise of cataract cases of the 80s,90s is due to sudden
increase of exposure to light due to electrification etc( as our grandparents
are more dependent on sun for light and eyes used to get ample relaxation &
rejuvenation time).  
The reason why all the light sources have got some or other problems is
because that all these are artificial sources of light. So this artificial
process of recreation of light is against the natural form is the vital reason
behind making it harmful for long exposures.  
  
So I have read more and realized that if the lights can be put in any casings
like glass shields or such decorative jars which not only enhance aesthetics
but also reduce the harmful effects of light.  
So don't use any bulbs directly as a light source. Don't let them be naked,
add some colorful clothes to them :P or add translucent shields so that
dissipates the light uniformly and takes at least 50-60%. of negative effects
of artificial lighting. Also the placing of the light source and the wall pain
colour etc are other things to enhance lighting and to reduce the dependency
on higher lumens.  
Just google yourself to realise the negative effects, if you don't trust in
some strangers free piece of advice :P.  
  
This piece of writing is just to share my views and not against any product or
company.  
The reason behind one star is my opinion against artificial lighting and its
ill effects but not for the particular products. The products are of good
quality and many of them work efficiently.  
Be rational and conscious, rather falling for consumerism.  
Stay healthy.  
Hope this info is helpful.👍🏼😊

Which might cause Irritation to some users.

its definitely a Good Deal.  
I do Recommend it.

I think this is my first negative review for Amazon product because this time

we put it in holder. And bulb cap was not properly fitted looks like a used

with discount. We can't sure whether it is new or not because Phillips doesn't
provide any seal on box. Now i will not buy any discounted products specially
lightning deals products because seller sells their defected product to these
lightning deal customers. I won't going to replace because i think it will
just waste of time and money. I hope this repaired or old bulb last long but
trust me i don't think it will last more.

Fundamental design flaw by Philips in this product.  
  
1\. The physical size of the bulb is small, compared with other brands.  
2\. The spherical plastic cover intended for the discrete light distribution,
covers the area very low as compared with other major brands like Osram.  
3\. In this product, the light distribution is designed to focus more to the
front area if we use the bulb in a wall fitted light.  
4\. But for suspended pendent lights or chandeliers type ceiling lights, the
light reflected from the ceiling is low which adversely affects the intensity
and coverage.  
5\. The plastic cover is just a diffuser to make light more uniform but the
low area covered by the plastic cover cause 10-15% light loss, I guess.  
6\. The bulb and the plastic cover could have covered more area by enlarging
the product size to make it more meaningful, I think.

Good

With LED bulb getting cheaper by the day, I decided to buy couple of Philips
9W LED bulbs for my home. In order to save energy and money.  
  
This bulb delivers 825 lumens of light.  
However, for my usage, 9W LED was bright enough.  
  
LED bulbs are also supposed to last longer than CFLs, but that is something
only time will tell.  
  
Overall I am quite happy with my purchase and I have already replaced all my
CFL ,florosent lamps to LED , my home consumption is reduced 60kwh in month,
aprximately I am saving 4*60= 240₹ per month.

Best 9watts price

Excellent Product.  
  
You can easily replace a 60W-100W Tube light with 12-Watt LED.  
  
I'm impressed with the performance and it's been a year i have been using them
and they work like a charm.

lights.

Bedrooms Get 9 Watt Led

Kitchen 9 Watt Led  
  
Earlier I had to rush to the local store to get the cfl lights replaced as
they were in warranty however now though there is 2 years warranty.  
  
None of them have failed in the past 1 year.  
  
power bill has also reduced.

Wrost product. I have purchased this in October 2017 after one day use one
blub got fused and got replacement, yesterday 16 Feb 2017 again one blub got
fused. Now the wrost part is I am struggling for warranty coverage nither
Amezon is takeing responsibility nor Philips, though blub has 2 years
warranty. I am not sure to whom I can contact for this so better to avoid
purchase led bulbs from here or at least Philips one who don't want to
entertain those customers who purchased bulbs online.

It is Very Bright 🔆. In the Cover for 3 LED , It's written that the price is
750 Rs. So, obviously you would be getting a Huge Discount by buying this Bulb
💡 from Amazon

No question about Amazon delivery and product quality. But after few days one
of the bulbs stopped working. When I contacted Amazon customer care they told
me that you will get a replacement in Philips service centre. Now, problem is
that service centre is quite far from my residence and time required to
replace a bulb is not justifiable.  
It would have been great if Amazon and manufacturer have some service
agreement and get the defective product under warranty replaced through the
Amazon Logistics itself.

Philips used to use much better materials in their Led, these looked made of
cheaper plastic and after 6 months one of the two bulbs has stopped working.  
  
Update in March - The second bulb has also stopped working now. I bought the
bulbs in Aug 2017 and i must say these were the worst LED bulbs i ever
purchased. Both bulbs died by 16th March 2018 ! What a waste !

Good quality thanks Amazon

service from Phillips.

Please don't buy it.

to order this but now i regret that i couldn't get some time to sit and read
the feedback before i placed the order.

stars if the above mentioned small defects were not present. Anyways I hope
these 4 LED bulbs with two 9 watt and two 14 watt combos give me the desired
efficient longevity although the Philips authentic hologram sticker is missing
while my old bulbs had those hologram stickers.
